newsitem.title: USA: New York State ends FY 1997 with huge surplus.
newsitem.headline: New York State ends FY 1997 with huge surplus.

text.p: The New York State Comptroller said Tuesday the state ended its 1997 fiscal year on April 1 with a $1.85 billion surplus, largely due to surging profits at Wall Street banks and brokerages.
Further, H. Carl McCall, in prepared remarks, noted that most of this huge sum was available for the state's new 1998 fiscal year.
